intro: Apargia hispida subsp. hastilis, commonly known as the rough apargia, is a perennial herb native to North America. It is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and is often found in the eastern United States. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and a robust stem that supports its foliage. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots.
